data.question: What is the chemical formula of KAUST-7?
What is the maximum theoretical pore aperture size of NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
Does NbOFFIVE-1-Ni adsorb propane at 298 K up to ~1 bar?
What is the heat of adsorption for propylene on NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
Can NbOFFIVE-1-Ni be regenerated and maintain its propylene adsorption capacity?
What is the role of (NbOF5)2– in NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
data.answer: It acts as a pillar, connecting Ni(II)-pyrazine square-grid layers and dictating the pore aperture size.

data.question: What is the adsorption capacity of NbOFFIVE-1-Ni for propylene in mol/kg/hour?
Is NbOFFIVE-1-Ni stable in the presence of water vapor?
What is the empirical formula of KAUST-7 collected at 298K?
Does NbOFFIVE-1-Ni adsorb N2 at 77 K?
What is the impact of using (NbOF5)2– instead of (SiF6)2– in NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
data.answer: It results in a longer metal-fluorine distance and a subsequent tilting of pyrazine molecules, reducing the pore aperture size.

data.question: What is the apparent surface area of NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
Can NbOFFIVE-1-Ni selectively separate propylene from propane?
What is the estimated pore volume of NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
What is the role of hydrogen bonding interactions in NbOFFIVE-1-Ni?
data.answer: They contribute to the restricted pore size opening by hindering the rotation of pyrazine ligands.

data.question: Is NbOFFIVE-1-Ni thermally stable?
What is the crystal system and space group of KAUST-7 collected at 100K?
What is the significance of the NbOFFIVE-1-Ni's pore aperture size for gas separation?
data.answer: The restricted pore aperture size allows for the selective molecular exclusion of propane from propylene.

data.question: Does NbOFFIVE-1-Ni have a high chemical stability?
What is the formula weight of KAUST-7 collected at 298K?
